blog.name: offscreenbabble
blog.title: Offscreen Babble: A TV and Movie Podcast
blog.description: What do you do after watching a new TV show or movie? Married couple Sade and Kyle analyze what they have watched but find that they have pretty different perspectives. On Offscreen Babble, they explore these differences and agree to disagree. https://apple.co/2JGp7Dg

title: @BBCAMERICA renueva @KillingEve para temporada 3 √
body:
@BBCAMERICA renueva @KillingEve para temporada 3 √

Jodie Comer y Sandra Oh en “Killing Eve” (2018). / Imagen via BBC America

La mañana después de su segundo regreso, BBC America sorprendió a las estrellas de Killing Eve el lunes 8 de abril con una renovación anticipada de la tercera temporada. La noticia fue anunciada en una cumbre para AMC Networks (incluidas BBC America e IFC) por la presidenta del grupo, Sarah Barnett. De acuerdo con su nueva…

summary: scissortailedsaint replied to your post “scissortailedsaint replied to your post: @scissortailedsaint (which is...”oh, i def...
body:
scissortailedsaint replied to your post “scissortailedsaint replied to your post: @scissortailedsaint (which is…”

oh, i def think villanelle would like to be known as herself! i don’t think she wants to pretend, i just don’t think she’d want to be rejected, as she was with anna. yeah, apart from anna, the whole ‘she doesn’t want to be rejected > acting abnormally makes ppl reject her > she tries to hide it’ thing is mostly speculation (informed by what i’ve read some ppl with ASPD say). i’m not sure exactly what 'being’ with ppl looks like for, but imo it’s clearly a goal.  (she tells eve just wants someone to watch movies with, a throwback to her apparently repeatedly trying to get konstatin to hang out, her affair w/ sebastian–like, girl’s lonely/bored!) i’m also considering stuff like this tinyurl.com/yy6fl3gj (I think PWB said something similar) and re: initially wanting to hide it from eve: tinyurl.com/yxb2rrew she just looks GUTTED when eve reveals this. i know she’d just brought out the fake tears but i think this reaction is sincere

Hm. I guess I wonder if Villanelle even knows what she wants, or if she thinks she wants one thing but will discover in trying to inhabit it that it’s not what she expected/not what is fulfilling? That is, the banality of Eve’s life, that thing that maybe Villanelle thinks she wants, the day-to-day life of spouses that Anna and her husband must have had and the role of spouse that maybe Villanelle wanted to supplant–it’s probably not stimulating, no matter how much Villanelle relishes observing it, dissecting it, imitating it. Because it’s putting on the motions–even for Eve and Niko it can be putting on the motions, like when they almost initiated sex and then decided they were too tired–and I wonder how quickly the novelty of it would fade.

Villanelle needs to be challenged to be stimulated and now it makes me wonder even more about the dynamics between Anna and Villanelle. What did that affair look like? What about it was exciting and magnetic? Was it the lust? Was it intellectual stimulation? Was it that Anna gave Villanelle attention and care and affection? What did Villanelle want out of it, what was her goal in eliminating the husband–simply to be the only object of affection in Anna’s life? What was she envisioning would happen after the husband was gone and presumably disappeared without incident? 

This is also my central question as a viewer in terms of what other viewers envision could happen between Eve and Villanelle? Because I have no idea how/if anything works between them aside from maybe hot and heavy hate/lust sex. I can’t picture a day-to-day. I can’t picture a plausible inhabiting of the same space. I don’t know. And it really makes me wonder if the show knows. I don’t even know if that’s one of the show’s prerogatives, to answer that question, or if its MO is always to sustain this cat-and-mouse framework, which runs a risk of getting old.

Because to confirm a Season 3 is to say that Season 2 lacks a resolution–in what areas, I don’t know. But mechanically, the show probably needs to keep Eve and Villanelle apart for tension and story. If not, that’s a far more fascinating question about how this show would move forward and, quite frankly, would present a huge challenge to a new showrunner. We’re only at the beginning of S2 but it’s hard not to think that the show already has a future that is being hammered out now on terms that we can’t even guess at.

blog.name: villanever
blog.title: shepherd's pie enthusiast
blog.description: anna. 20. screenwriter. i do a podcast.

summary: Soft villanelle headcannon: Villanelle doesn't kill Niko. He's nice, doesn't pull the 'job or me' on Eve, just wants answers...
question: Soft villanelle headcannon: Villanelle doesn't kill Niko. He's nice, doesn't pull the 'job or me' on Eve, just wants answers which is valid because any spouse would if you go on an impromptu trip and come back mentally/emotionally disturbed and was super supportive in the start even though he didn't know crap, just that Eve was happy. I want Villanelle×Eve but Niko is an good man and I don't want him to die horribly. He's a great husband. Villanelle killing Gabriel doesn't sit well with me.
answer:
i don’t think villanelle is going to kill niko either. 

i think she will give eve a choice. 

she tried killing a woman’s husband before and didn’t that blow up in her face? didn’t she lose everything because of that? 

she’s learned. she’s older. kind of. she won’t make the same mistake twice. 

she wants eve to actively choose her. she wants eve to want her as much as she wants eve herself. she wants it to be mutual. that thing with anna? the power dynamic was so off. with eve, they’re equals. it defeats the purpose if their relationship isn’t an equal decision. it loses the weight. 

of course, i think she’s going to try to make eve choose her and pull out all the fucking stops to get her to do so, but i also think she knows that it’s ultimately eve’s decision to choose. no matter how cocky she is about the choice being her. 

therefore, it would be pointless to kill niko because it would only drive them apart. it would take away eve’s choice. it would take away the active role she is now playing in her own life. 

also, personally, i want eve to make that choice too. her whole arc this season is about the darkness consuming her. it’s going to come down to her choosing her old life, niko, or her new one, villanelle. darkness vs light. her decision is going to be the climax. it’s going to solidify a new facet of her character. 

im very excited.

blog.name: villanever
blog.title: shepherd's pie enthusiast
blog.description: anna. 20. screenwriter. i do a podcast.

tags: i tweaked this one a bit
summary: Soft!V Headcanon: Villanelle likes to kiss Eve hello when she gets back from work
question: Soft!V Headcanon: Villanelle likes to kiss Eve hello when she gets back from work
answer:
i tweaked this one a lil but i still love it

they’re supposed to be a secret. 

well, relatively a secret. 

sometimes villanelle looks really fucking hot when she walks into work, and she gives eve these eyes, and the bathroom can fit two people, you know? 

no one’s noticed yet. as far as she can tell. 

but when that stuff happens it’s feral. it’s biting. scratching. teeth clashing into each other. it’s everything eve imagined it would be. 

lately, however, she’s been doing this thing. eve does her daily climb up the stairs in the building to their office, and villanelle is leaning against the wall, waiting for her. she’s always there. eve doesn’t know how she gets there so early. or how long she’s been waiting. she’s afraid to ask. 

she’s leaning against the wall, and her eyes light up when eve approaches her. she watches eve struggle to unlock the office door as she stands directly next to her, their shoulders brushing. 

once eve manages to jiggle it open, she says, “eve. wait.”

eve turns, and villanelle cups her cheek and leans in. she brushes their lips together, and eve feels her eyes flutter closed. 

it’s soft like the pink sky in the early mornings. peaceful. the time when no one is awake yet, or even wants to be. it’s just the two of them. in the stairwell. kissing. 

she rests her forehead on eve’s then slowly pulls away. eve is buzzing. her eyes are half-lidded, pupils blown. eve can’t stop staring. 

villanelle smiles then strolls into the office as if nothing happened. 

this has been going on for a week now, and eve doesn’t know what to fucking think. 

she supposes she should enjoy it. the tiny glimpses that villanelle reserves for eve. the glimpses of the youthful teenage girl stumbling her way through love. the one who wants to kiss a girl breathless before she goes into work. the one who plays with her lover’s hair as they talk about nothing and stare at the ceiling. the one who she was. 

eve used to wonder why anna fell in love with her. she was a troubled kid. committing crimes. she was cheeky. an asshole. 

but

she gives eve these morning kisses every morning before the world is awake and running. 

eve doesn’t wonder anymore.

but when that stuff happens it’s feral. it’s biting. scratching. teeth clashing into each other. it’s everything eve imagined it would be. 

lately, however, she’s been doing this thing. eve does her daily climb up the stairs in the building to their office, and villanelle is leaning against the wall, waiting for her. she’s always there. eve doesn’t know how she gets there so early. or how long she’s been waiting. she’s afraid to ask. 

she’s leaning against the wall, and her eyes light up when eve approaches her. she watches eve struggle to unlock the office door as she stands directly next to her, their shoulders brushing. 

once eve manages to jiggle it open, she says, “eve. wait.”

eve turns, and villanelle cups her cheek and leans in. she brushes their lips together, and eve feels her eyes flutter closed. 

it’s soft like the pink sky in the early mornings. peaceful. the time when no one is awake yet, or even wants to be. it’s just the two of them. in the stairwell. kissing. 

she rests her forehead on eve’s then slowly pulls away. eve is buzzing. her eyes are half-lidded, pupils blown. eve can’t stop staring. 

villanelle smiles then strolls into the office as if nothing happened. 

this has been going on for a week now, and eve doesn’t know what to fucking think. 

she supposes she should enjoy it. the tiny glimpses that villanelle reserves for eve. the glimpses of the youthful teenage girl stumbling her way through love. the one who wants to kiss a girl breathless before she goes into work. the one who plays with her lover’s hair as they talk about nothing and stare at the ceiling. the one who she was. 

eve used to wonder why anna fell in love with her. she was a troubled kid. committing crimes. she was cheeky. an asshole. 

but

she gives eve these morning kisses every morning before the world is awake and running. 

eve doesn’t wonder anymore.

tags: getting to some of these today
idk if i like this one that much BUT
summary: soft!v headcanon: the first time villanelle visited eve's home she was bold, confident because she knew what she wanted to gain...
question: soft!v headcanon: the first time villanelle visited eve's home she was bold, confident because she knew what she wanted to gain from the quick visit. the next time, though, something has changed. this time, villanelle is expected, wanted even. and it makes her nervous, overly polite out of fear of ruining everything and being kicked out of the house. when she walks in behind eve, she removes her coat and just stands in the doorway, waiting for instructions. eve finds the juxtaposition endearing.
answer:
she’s quiet, eve notices. 

when she’s not being an insufferable dick, she’s quiet. fragile. thoughtful. an expression that mirrors the one she saw so close on the bed that day. 

an expression very different from the one she saw so close against the fridge on that other day. 

there are too many fucking days, eve thinks. too many fucking days. 

her mood changes like the wind. she makes a joke and then fades into herself, gets lost. she drifts. eve also notices these moments tend to be only for her. the others see the mask she puts up, but eve sees her. she sees her after hours, before she gets escorted back to her prison in a five star hotel, and they are the last two in the office. eve moves things around on a corkboard, and villanelle is quiet. eyes focused on eve. she doesn’t say a word. 

carolyn told her that villanelle was being uncooperative in her hotel room. eve doesn’t know what uncooperative means, but she could reasonably assume it wracked up a hefty hotel bill for mi6. 

“maybe…” carolyn mused at a farmer’s market she forced eve to attend. she picked up an avocado and squeezed it. “maybe she could stay with you. you seem to be the only one she tolerates.”

eve had sputtered. “stay with me? assassin who tried to kill me. you want her to stay with me.”

carolyn gave her a cold stare.  “it’s for the sake of the investigation, eve. we need her.” she placed the avocado in her reusable shopping back and ignored eve’s further protests. 

so, that’s why after work on tuesday, villanelle stays late, but she is not escorted to her fancy hotel by a security team. she rides in the passenger seat of eve’s toyota corolla, wearing a wool coat, and stares out the window as they drive down london streets. 

and she’s quiet. she’s really quiet. 

eve clears her throat. grips the wheel. “fun day at the office today, huh?”

villanelle glances at her out of the corner of eye. “it was the same.” she looks back to the window. “boring.”

eve bites the inside of her cheek. her attempt at conversation devolves into silence. 

“carolyn seemed to think you would be excited to stay with me.”

this catches villanelle’s attention. “i move from one cage to the next,” she responds bluntly. 

“and you refuse to have sex with me so this won’t be fun at all.” there it is. 

eve glares at the road ahead. 

villanelle grins, satisfied with the amount of irritation she’s caused. eve pulls into her driveway and parks the car. they get out, and eve fumbles for her keys while villanelle stands obnoxiously close to her back. 

eve hears her tsk. “shut up. there are like 20 fucking office keys. it’s hard to sort through them.”

“whatever you say, eve.” eve swears she can feel her breath on her neck. 

keys. victory. 

she unlocks the door, and they step inside. 

home sweet home. 

assassin sweet assassin. 

eve is reminded of the last time they were in her home together. villanelle was bold. brave. confident. mischievous. 

now, eve turns to face her, and she’s quiet. small. fragile. 

she stands in the doorway and removes her coat in one slow fluid movement. eve heads to the kitchen. she’s fucking starving. she skipped lunch in favor of tracking down a witness. a good choice, in her opinion, but her body doesn’t seem to agree. 

she starts fixing herself a pb&j when she notices she’s not being accosted. certainly villanelle would have harassed her by now. 

“villanelle?” eve calls out. she leaves her knife and bread on the counter and walks back to the entry way. 

villanelle is still there, holding her coat. that soft fragile expression plastered across her visage. 

“where should i put my coat?” 

“you’ve been standing here for the past 5 minutes trying to figure out where to put your coat?”

villanelle blinks. “you didn’t tell me.”

eve laughs. 

“last time you barged in here, broke my bathroom door, insulted my clothes, ate my food, stole my phone, and left.”  

villanelle furrows her eyebrows like she doesn’t understand what eve is saying. “but now i am a guest. and i don’t want to intrude on your home.”

“you were literally an intruder”

“i’m not right now.”

“but you were.”

“im pretty sure were implies not anymore, eve. i don’t want to be rude.” she shuffles, and it dawns on eve. 

the quietness in the car. the lack of general asshole-ry. the coat. villanelle is nervous. she’s nervous to be eve’s guest. 

it’s wonderfully ironic. 

and it’s exceptionally endearing. 

eve cracks up. she laughs harder than she had in the gare du nord when that lady thought she was a crack addict. 

this angers villanelle. “eve, why are you laughing? eve, it’s not funny.” 

eve can’t stop herself. 

“fine.” villanelle throws her coat on the floor and stomps off. eve picks it up and watches her retreating form. she hangs it on the coat rack. 

maybe this slumber party won’t be so bad.

blog.description:
A multi-fandom blog run by a girl with dreams of being a writer.
I'm Wren.
23yrs old, humani. 
INTP, Virgo, Ravenclaw.
Expect a variety of fandom, general, and personal posts. Also be ready for bouts of obsession over random shows...

summary: So like, we all know we’re gonna come circling back to that “Eve laughing hysterically at being called a junkie” moment and have...
body: So like, we all know we’re gonna come circling back to that “Eve laughing hysterically at being called a junkie” moment and have scream at it because Eve is pretty much becoming a junkie for Villanelle and the murdery lifestyle she represents in Eve’s mind yeah?

reblog.comment: So like, we all know we’re gonna come circling back to that “Eve laughing hysterically at being called a junkie” moment and have scream at it because Eve is pretty much becoming a junkie for Villanelle and the murdery lifestyle she represents in Eve’s mind yeah?
